item.title: how do apply free internship 2021?
item.dc:creator: prakash
item.description: what is an internship? According to me, an internship is a limited period of time , working experience offered by an employer is given to students. I classified internship into two types paid and voluntary internships.The trend is now voluntary internships, they lot of organization offered voluntary internships.As coming to paid internships, it is usually… Read More »how do apply free internship 2021?
item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents
  • what is an internship?
  • how to apply for an internship?
  • what is Internshala?
  • how to apply for an internship through Internshala?
    • how to log in Internshala?
    • how to find an internship?
    • How to check a genuine internship?
    • How to add Education details in Internshala?
    • How to add Experience, skills, work samples in internshala ?
    • How to answer basic interview questions?
  • Conclusion

what is an internship?

According to me, an internship is a limited period of time , working experience offered by an employer is given to students.

I classified internship into two types paid and voluntary internships.
The trend is now voluntary internships, they lot of organization offered voluntary internships.
As coming to paid internships, it is usually a lot competitive to select that internship. Yep! this is a competitive world. Don’t worry I give some ideas and tricks to get paid internships.. keep reading…

how to apply for an internship?

Basically there following different methods in various organization…let see detailed about.

  • The high-level organization require to fill out an online application form.
  • sometimes they said to send an application through a general email address.
  • some organization says submit your resume or cv through the website portal.

As a beginner, you fealing hard to find a good internship but my suggestion is to try ‘Internshala it’s an open free platform. I explained step by step how to get an internship through Internshala.

what is Internshala?

Internshala is India’s big internship platform, it connects the organization looking for interns and students who are interested in the internship and, with 40000+ paid internships in Engineering, MBA, media, law, arts, and other streams.

how to apply for an internship through Internshala?

how to log in Internshala?

if you already signup Internshala then ignore this step move to next.

Let see details about this step by step. first, click here it redirects to the Internshala website. Then you find the register button click that it shows two options select “As a Student “

Next step you will enter email, the first name, last name and password then click signup. After that, it sends a verification link through Gmail and verified it.

After verify your email it will redirects to personal details page.

Enter your details, and make sure given correct phone number, some organization make telephone interview. and hit the save & next button.

then next page shows preferences select ”Internships” after that it shows internship type looking for work from home or office . just select Work from home because in this covid situation many organizations preferred WFH .

Next below you find which field is looking for an internship. select your interested internship. I give some basic field which all works have basic English knowledge Digital marketing, marketing, sales, proofreading, social media marketing, transcription/ translation, campus ambassador, event management, data entry, teaching, volunteering. Then hit the save button.

after this step completed , you ready to find internship.

how to find an internship?

The dashboard shows a lot of internships in work from home. Normally first in the dashboard, it shows ongoing contest or online training skills, basically, it will be paid. After that, it shows a lot of free internships, scroll down, and see many opportunities.

But now we going to use filters, it saves maximum amount of time.

Go on category, then select your interested internships Make sure choose at least 5. if you have not aware of these skills then choose a basic internship, if you have some basic English knowledge definitely rock on that internships.

click the work from home toolbar and leave as it as stipend range zero. Refer the image below.

Now you are able to see interesting internships in the dashboard. Then click on any internship and it shows the full detailed information. let’s find whether it is a genuine internship.

How to check a genuine internship?

  • Pay attention to sources
  • Do some research
  • Look at requirements
  • Look for compensation details

Refer to this image below. It gives a lot of information about Internships and does some research about an organization on google. Look at requirements and stipend or salary given in the job details.

After that verified all details about the organization and you are ready to move to apply for an internship. Next, to click on Apply now it redirects to add Education details page, if you already entered it redirects to your resume page.

How to add Education details in Internshala?

If you are adding more details to your resume will increase your chances of getting selected. so fill in all possible entry. And also add accurate details.

If you are currently pursuing any degree then fill in college name, degree and stream name and also CGPA or percentage.

Add your past study details 10th and 12th grade details too…

How to add Experience, skills, work samples in internshala ?

If you have worked previously any jobs then fill it in jobs and if you have completed any internships fill it in internship column. Most of the organization is looking for experienced person.

next skill, there is a real trick the organization got a lot of applications you want to be unique, Don’t put unrelated skills on that. For example, the company is related to web development then search google for what type of project is doing, they’re using WordPress or static pages. Then put on the skills they looking for.

But in most case we didn’t have any experience, then what you going to do is make your project and link into the Internshala. Let see how to do this. First make your project, if its project is related to web development make your own site and link it or if you good at coding then link it to your git hub account or if you are good at designing then link it to your Behance Portfolio or else if your project is not in this category, then share your project through google drive.

After all this completed it will generate your resume then you click proceed to application.

How to answer basic interview questions?

Why should you be hired for this role?

  • Highlight your strengths – mention any experience (internship/job experience or extra-curricular activities), accomplishments, skills that are relevant to the role.
  • Show enthusiasm – mention what excites you about this role and the company. You can go through their website/ social media to understand what interests you
  • Do not copy answers from the internet.

Are you available for 2 month, starting immediately, for a full-time work from home internship?

These type of question answer your available time clearly.

  • For the prescribed two month internship I would like to extend my joining immediately.
  • I am available to work in your esteemed from this point in time. As this internship is home-based I would like to start the internship at this regular point in time.
  • To start new can we start by the next month starting as there are only 2 days left for the next month to begin and looking forward to hearing from you soon

Conclusion

Try as much possible to apply internships at regular interval. Don’t afraid of failures keep trying. Then it becomes experienced to answer the interview questions and keep at practicing on real projects. Feel free to contact me to clarify any doubt.

contact me

item.title: 6G Technology
item.dc:creator: shan
item.description: Hey guys, the general meaning for 6G,5G,4G,2G is called the generation of the wireless network. When upgrading to a new version of the network the speed of the net will be high. Thinking about the first generation that time only mobile was invented and the mobile considers of 1kg weight. It cannot be used personally,… Read More »6G Technology
item.content:encoded:
Hey guys, the general meaning for 6G,5G,4G,2G is called the generation of the wireless network. When upgrading to a new version of the network the speed of the net will be high. Thinking about the first generation that time only mobile was invented and the mobile considers of 1kg weight. It cannot be used personally, but now you can use mobiles personally. When the generation upgrade the size of mobile reduces. In the same way, when the upgrade of generation of the wireless network the speed of the internet increases.

During 1G network usage, the message sending and receiving speed was 2.4kbps. (‘kbps’ is nothing kilobytes per second ) measuring unit of internet speed. During 2G the speed was 40kbps, those time only you can use text message and picture message are introduced.

when coming to 3G, it was quite smarter and faster to use , compare to 2G and 1G.

But in 4G the speed of net was 500 times faster than 3G. when introduced 4G, we more used of youtube and more net consuming app are used at high speed

Next is about 5G, low latency network are fined, it is more used in the medical field and car companies. All the countries are moving on 5G nowadays, but in India, it will come soon.

Let see about our main topic 6G. The speed of 6G, was 11 Gbps, using this speed you can download 11 hours of video in few seconds. It is more used in mixed reality live cars, drone, robots. It is very important latern for the medical field. The speed of time was related to real-time speed. The 6G contains SUB MM waves in the ratio of 10:1 of 5G.

item.title: Covaxin VS Covishield which is safer and Efficient ? in 2021
item.dc:creator: prakash
item.description: Introduction: The second phase of the COVID-19 vaccine program has begun in India, and many people still do not know how the two vaccines – Covaxin and Covishield – differ from each other. Let see Covaxin vs Covishield. The second phase started on March 1, when people over the age of 60 and those over… Read More »Covaxin VS Covishield which is safer and Efficient ? in 2021
item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents
  • Introduction
  • What should you find?
  • Covaxin VS Covishield – Difference between each other
  • Detailed about Covaxin:
  • Detailed about Covidshield:
  • Conclusion:
  • Reference:

Introduction:

The second phase of the COVID-19 vaccine program has begun in India, and many people still do not know how the two vaccines – Covaxin and Covishield – differ from each other. Let see Covaxin vs Covishield.

The second phase started on March 1, when people over the age of 60 and those over the age of 45 with related comorbidities could take a life-saving gun.

Currently, the government does not allow people to decide which vaccine they want to receive, but the results of the first phase clearly show that both vaccines in India are safe and effective.

Click here for recent news about Covid.

What should you find?

In India, more than 18.8Cr(Fully vacinated approx 3% of population in india) people have received COVID of two approved vaccines, Covaxin and Covishield. During the second wave of deadly coronavirus, the third vaccine COVID-19 was approved for use in India. Russia’s Sputnik V is considered safe and is similar to the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine made in India as ‘Covishield’.

Sputnik V offers 92% protection (approx.) On Covid-19 and has already arrived in India. The approval of this policy came at a time when India was crossing the border into Brazil to become the most affected nation with the global epidemic. With the Government launching the third phase of testing for 18 years and older, let’s take a look at where the preparation drug is best for you. Let see the major difference between Covaxin Vs covishield

Covaxin VS Covishield – Difference between each other

Detailed about Covaxin:

Covaxin has been clinically shown to be effective in combating COVID-19, and it may also preventing mutant variants from spreading. While the vaccine is a traditional model and carries no side effects of reactogenic-side effects, research studies and data collected on vaccine have so far shown that in all vaccines, Covaxin brings a small number of side effects, such as fever, redness, cold or pain to the injection site.

Therefore, for someone who is in pain, or worried about side effects, choosing Covaxin may be the safest option, according to Dr. Kataria. It is also possible that side effects are milder, and make your vaccination experience safer.
Currently, Covaxin also has a shorter timeline of dosage, which means doses will be given outside of 4-6 weeks. One can also make the right decision, especially if they are committed to the future, or are at high risk for the dangers of COVID-19.

Those with a history or risk of hemorrhage(blood clotting) may also be advised to take Covaxin at present as a blood clot is a reported result of Covishield. However, it is still considered something ‘unusual’ .

Detailed about Covidshield:

Covishield has been one of the first approved vaccines and widely used in India, since January 2021. Although it is also a traditional vaccine, Dr. Kataria warns that young people, who prefer Oxford-Astrazeneca , often experience more serious side effects than those who receive Covaxin. Several reports also point out that Covishield shows a more immune response (hence, it makes way for more side effects).

The Covishield is also given primarily to the elderly or those with serious comorbidities. Those between the ages of 18-45 should also observe their health limits before registering for the vaccine.
However, talking about the benefits, Dr. Kataria added that Covishield puts in more antibodies, compared to Covaxin (although its performance levels are the same weight). Those with weakened immune systems may consider taking this action.

Conclusion:

If COVID-19 is spreading in your community, stay safe by taking some simple precautions, such as vaccinated, physical distancing, wearing a mask, keeping rooms well ventilated, avoiding crowds, cleaning your hands, and coughing into a bent elbow or tissue. Check local advice where you live and work. Do it all!

Reference:

  • https://www.who.int/teams/risk-communication/covid-19-transmission-package
  • https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=de.xikolo.openwho

Disclaimer:

The information contained on this site is for educational purposes only and is not intended to replace medical care by a health professional. Because of each person’s unique needs, the student should consult with their physician to determine if the information is appropriate for the student’s situation.

item.title: If you are not interested in engineering but joined an engineering
item.dc:creator: prakash
item.description: Introduction: What you want to do if you are not interested in engineering, but you have already joined an engineering college ?? If you like the course and want to be an engineer, then You can use the four years to improve your technical knowledge and explore your career options related to the field of… Read More »If you are not interested in engineering but joined an engineering
item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents
  • Introduction:
  • Why the students are not interested in engineering?
  • My suggestion:
    • Try to place a company
    • Fun tip:
    • Serious Tip:
  • Take up an internship:
  • A final note for you guys:

Introduction:

What you want to do if you are not interested in engineering, but you have already joined an engineering college ??

If you like the course and want to be an engineer, then You can use the four years to improve your technical knowledge and explore your career options related to the field of engineering.

Basically Why the students are not interested in engineering?

There are two kinds of students who hate engineering;

  • First would be the student who is forced to do engineering against his/her interest.
  • The second is the student who would have joined the course with some interest but over a period of time, the academic and college stress would have destroyed all the interest and liking the student had for the engineering degree.

If you hate engineering and if you want to change track to a non-engineering field after college, then it is better to start planning from your first or second year itself. First, take a month to cry and cry as much as you want for taking engineering. After you have cried enough, wipe your tears away and realize rest of the years you going to love your work.

My suggestion:

Did you know, why many students join engineering colleges ?

Try to place a company

Even though you may not be interested in pursuing a career related to engineering or IT, it is financially safe to have a job at hand. Usually, there is a one year gap between your final semester exam and your date of joining. You can use this time to plan or prepare for your masters in a course where your interest lies. If your ultimate goal is to start your own business or social venture and if your parents are not financially well-off, you can use the employment to save for your future plans. However, you need to ensure that careers and the responsibilities of adult life.

Fun tip:

If you get placed and reject the job offer, starting a non-engineering career path, adds glamour to your new venture. You can proudly say that you rejected a job offer at a Bangalore I.T. company to follow your passion.


Serious Tip:

If your parents are very conservative and strict, you can use your campus placement as an escape route.

Take up an internship:


There are two types of internships which you should take during college

  • At a company related to your course of study.
    This is important because it will help you understand whether your mindset is suitable to work in that field for the rest of your life. If you are pursuing an electronic engineering course, apply for an internship in electronic companies, where you will get hands-on experience in the job profile of an electronic engineer; and you can check whether you are ready to push yourself every day of your life to design machines, draw circuits and develop signal systems. If possible, talk openly with the company’s manager and get a practical understanding of what you will be doing when you work in such a company.
  • Take an internship in the field of your choice.
    This second type of internship is for the large majority of our youngster are doing. If you want to be a writer, work at a bookstore or a publishing company. If you want to be a photographer, apply for a part-time photography assignment in a local magazine, freelancer. Whatever your field of interest is, take a list of companies in that field and check for the ones in your city or nearer to your college. Tell them that you are considering a future in their field and you feel an internship there will help you assess your potential.

A final note for you guys:

Whatever your choice is, do realize that deviating from engineering is nothing to be ashamed of. Obviously, when you shift from engineering to non-engineering field, there will be arguments like, ‘you wasted four years in engineering’, ‘you could have given the engineering seat to someone else’, ‘you should have taken up arts’, etc.

It is better to waste the four years in engineering and shift to your field of interest now, instead of regretting when you are in your 40year’s that you have ended up wasting your entire life in pursuing a career without any interest. Cheers! all the best for your career.

If you have any doubts feel free to contact me.
